results.title: Hemodynamic vertebrobasilar insufficiency as an adverse effect of antihypertensive therapy.
results.text_hl: A 63-year-old white male with a 25-year history of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ experienced the onset of intermittent @<m>DISEASE_Diplopia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004172 @@@diplopia@@@ and @DISEASE_Gait_Disorders_Neurologic @DISEASE_MESH:D020233 @@@gait disturbance@@@ 24 hours after a change in antihypertensive medication from @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 50 mg/d to @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ 5 mg bid.

citations.NLM: Fagan SC, McCormick PW, Diaz FG. Hemodynamic vertebrobasilar insufficiency as an adverse effect of antihypertensive therapy. DICP. 1989 Mar;23(3):238-9. PMID: 2541568
citations.BibTeX: @article{2541568, title={Hemodynamic vertebrobasilar insufficiency as an adverse effect of antihypertensive therapy.}, author={Fagan SC and McCormick PW and Diaz FG}, journal={DICP}, volume={23}, number={3}, pages={238-9}}
